The constructor EventManager(String) states that a null thread name is allowed. However, if I create an event manager with null thread name, I get an NPE when an event is dispatched. It needs to pass a non-null thread name to the Thread constructor, or call a Thread constructor that doesn't take a thread name argument.

java.lang.NullPointerException
	at java.lang.Thread.<init>(Thread.java:260)
	at java.lang.Thread.<init>(Thread.java:369)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager$EventThread.<init>(EventManager.java:271)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.EventManager.getEventThread(EventManager.java:178)
	at org.eclipse.osgi.framework.eventmgr.ListenerQueue.dispatchEventAsynchronous(ListenerQueue.java:112)
	at org.eclipse.equinox.prov.core.eventbus.ProvisioningEventBus.publishEvent(ProvisioningEventBus.java:65)

This is a regression caused by bug 195845.  Here is a fix to generate a thread name if null is used.

I would prefer the generated thread name be something more like "EventManagerThread" or "EventManager EventThread". I think "EventThread" is too vague and doesn't properly associate the thread with the code (eventmanager) which created it.
I change the generated name to "EventManagerThread-" in HEAD.
